description: Manages a networking V2 trunk resource within OpenStack.

PortId.description: The ID of the port to be made a subport of the trunk.

SegmentationId.description: The numeric id of the subport segment.

SegmentationType.description: The segmentation technology to use, e.g., "vlan".

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AdminStateUp.description:
Administrative up/down status for the trunk
(must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the
`admin_state_up` of an existing trunk.

Description.description:
Human-readable description of the trunk. Changing this
updates the name of the existing trunk.

Name.description:
A unique name for the trunk. Changing this
updates the `name` of an existing trunk.

PortId.description:
The ID of the port to be used as the parent port of the
trunk. This is the port that should be used as the compute instance network
port. Changing this creates a new trunk.

Region.description:
The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a trunk. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
trunk.

Tags.description: A set of string tags for the port.

TenantId.description:
The owner of the Trunk. Required if admin wants
to create a trunk on behalf of another tenant. Changing this creates a new trunk.
